Text:
Dalam Al-Quran, Allah bagitau,

Jika Allah membuka pintu langit dan orang² kafir ni naik ke atas melaluinya, mereka tetap akan menolak kebenaran dengan berkata;

"Penglihatan kami dikaburkan, kami terkena sihir".

Maksudnya, mereka tetap takkan beriman.
Translated Text:
In the Quran, God says,

If God opens the door of heaven and these infidels go up through it, they will still reject the truth by saying;

"Our vision is obscured, we are struck by magic".

Meaning, they will still not believe.

Text:
Kita boleh berusaha beri pencerahan kepada orang yang tidak percaya tentang kebenaran Islam.

Tetapi percayalah.

Kalau hati mereka telah tertutup daripada menerima kebenaran, berilah pencerahan apa pun, mereka tetap takkan terima dan menolak.
Translated Text:
We can try to enlighten people who do not believe in the truth of Islam.

But trust me.

If their hearts have been closed from accepting the truth, give any enlightenment, they will still not accept and refuse.

Text:
Sebab pernah kerja Mahkamah Syariah, aku kongsi langkah-langkah kalau nak BERCERAI secara baik (persetujuan bersama).

Sebelum tu, cerai ada beberapa jenis.

1. Secara baik.
2. Tanpa persetujuan bersama.
3. Fasakh
4. Takliq
5. Tebus talaq
6. Luar mahkamah.

Semua flow berbeza.
Translated Text:
Because I have worked in the Syariah Court, I share the steps if you want to DIVORCE amicably (mutual consent).

Before that, there were several types of divorce.

1. In a good way.
2. Without mutual consent.
3. Fasakh
4. Takliq
5. Make up for divorce
6. Out of court.

All flows are different.

Text:
Kalau cerai secara persetujuan bersama (baik), ia proses paling MUDAH. Sebab dua-dua telah bersetuju untuk berpisah.

Tak perlu peguam sebab takde proses perbicaraan.

Langkah-langkah:

1. Pastikan mohon di Mahkamah Syariah tempat mastautin. Bukan duduk N9, mohon di KL.
Translated Text:
If the divorce is by mutual consent (good), it is the easiest process. Because both have agreed to separate.

No need for a lawyer because there is no trial process.

Steps:

1. Make sure to apply at the Syariah Court where you reside. Not sitting in N9, please in KL.

Text:
2. Daftar penceraian di MS dengan isi borang + bayar yuran pendaftaran. Masa tu akan dapat tarikh hadir ke mahkamah (max 21 hari). Bukan korang je nak cerai, ada beratus pasangan lain.

3. Sampai tarikh tu, kedua-dua suami isteri kena hadir. Bawa Sijil Nikah & MyKad.
Translated Text:
2. Register the divorce in MS by filling out the form + paying the registration fee. At that time you will get a date to appear in court (max 21 days). You are not the only one who wants to divorce, there are hundreds of other couples.

3. Until that date, both husband and wife must be present. Bring the Marriage Certificate & MyKad.

Text:
4. Mahkamah dapatkan persetujuan cerai dari kedua-dua pasangan. Kemudian suami akan LAFAZ TALAQ satu.

5. Mahkamah akan keluarkan ‘Perintah Daftar Cerai’. Masa ini memang sah kedua-duanya bukan lagi suami-isteri (legal).

6. Bawa surat tu ke Pejabat Agama untuk daftar cerai.
Translated Text:
4. The court obtains divorce consent from both spouses. Then the husband will SAY TALAQ one.

5. The court will issue a 'Divorce Registration Order'. This time it is true that both are no longer husband and wife (legally).

6. Take the letter to the Religious Office to register the divorce.

Text:
7. Kat Pejabat Agama, mereka perlukan Sijil Nikah, IC dan Perintah Daftar Cerai Mahkamah Syariah tadi.

8. Jabatan Agama daftarkan cerai dan keluarkan ‘Sijil Cerai’ sebagai bukti penceraian berlaku.

9. Selesai.

Kat Selangor, kalau cerai secara baik ni ada ‘fast-track cerai’.
Translated Text:
7. At the Religious Office, they need a Marriage Certificate, IC and Divorce Registration Order from the Syariah Court earlier.

8. The Department of Religion registers the divorce and issues a 'Certificate of Divorce' as proof that the divorce has taken place.

9. Done.

In Selangor, if the divorce is amicable, there is a 'fast-track divorce'.

Text:
‘Fast Track’ ni proses kat Mahkamah tadi, boleh selesai dalam sehari je. Datang awal pagi, petang dah selesai.

TAPI.

1. Kena datang awal pagi (selain Rabu dan Jumaat).
2. Kena bercerai baik, takde pertikaian yang perlu masuk bicara hakim.
3. Sebab penceraian jelas.
Translated Text:
This 'Fast Track' process at the Court earlier, can be completed in just one day. Come early in the morning, the evening is over.

BUT.

1. Have to come early in the morning (except Wednesday and Friday).
2. Get a good divorce, there is no dispute that needs to be heard by a judge.
3. The reason for the divorce is clear.

Text:
4. Alasan cliche ‘Tiada Persefahaman’ tu memang hakim jarang terima. Kena tulis jelas, contoh penderaan fizikal, tak bersama atau bertegur sapa lebih setahun dll.

5. Isteri kena suci masa daftarkan cerai.

Kalau haritu kes Mahkamah penuh, baru diberi hari lain.
Translated Text:
4. The cliche excuse 'No Understanding' is rarely accepted by judges. Have to write clearly, examples of physical abuse, not being together or talking to each other for more than a year etc.

5. The wife must be chaste when registering the divorce.

If the Court case is full that day, it will be given another day.

Text:
Kalau bercerai bergaduh ni biasanya perlu masa yang panjang. Sebab kena lalu j/k pendamai & masuk bicara dengan hakim.

Kalau Fasakh/Ta’liq pula kena lantik peguam untuk pembelaan dan tuntutan balas. Kena bawa bukti (laporan doktor, resit, bil dll).

Kalau rajin aku sambung.
Translated Text:
If you get divorced, fighting usually takes a long time. Because it has to pass because of the peacemaker & talk to the judge.

If Fasakh/Ta'liq has to appoint a lawyer for defense and counterclaim. Have to bring proof (doctor's report, receipt, bill etc.).

If I'm diligent, I'll continue.

Text:
Kesimpulannya, proses cerai secara baik ni lebih mudah & cepat nak selesai.

Bila ada pertikaian, hakim kena dengar hujah kedua-dua belah pihak dan bawa bukti berkaitan.

1 pasangan makan masa 45 minit bicara. 1 hari tak dapat dengar kes banyak. Tapi yang daftar banyak.

Itulah.
Translated Text:
In conclusion, the divorce process is easier & quick to finish.

When there is a dispute, the judge must listen to the arguments of both sides and bring relevant evidence.

1 couple eats 45 minutes of talk time. 1 day can not hear many cases. But there are many registers.

That's it.

Text: @acaiijawe Bukan cerai secara baik pun ada proses sulkh (betul ke ejaan ni) jugak ke tuan?
Translated Text: @acaiijawe It's not an amicable divorce, but there is a sulkh process (spelling correctly) sir?

Text:
@afaizrosli Biasanya yang melalui proses Sulh ni yang suami atau isteri tidak bersetuju untuk bercerai atau ada urusan lain. Sebab proses tu dikenali j/k pendamai.

Boleh tidak jadi cerai, setuju cerai atau bicara depan hakim.
Translated Text:
@afaizrosli Usually those who go through the Sulh process are those whose husbands or wives do not agree to divorce or have other matters. Because that process is known as peacemaker.

Can not be divorced, agree to divorce or talk in front of a judge.

Who knows, only disagreements can be resolved.

Text: @acaiijawe salam ustaz, bagaimana saya bersalin di awal ramadhan dan masih dalam nifas sepanjang bulan ramadhan. perlu qada’ dan fidyah kan? saya difahamkan kena bayar fidyah.
Translated Text: @acaiijawe greetings teacher, how did I give birth at the beginning of Ramadan and still be in labor throughout the month of Ramadan. need qada' and fidyah right? I understand that I have to pay a ransom.

Text:
@afqahshrm Salam, hukum Nifas adalah sama seperti Haid.

Secara umumnya, kena gantikan puasa semasa nifas (tak perlu fidyah). Cuma kalau ada baki yang melangkau Ramadan tahun hadapannya, bayar Fidyah atas baki tersebut sahaja.
Translated Text:
@afqahshrm Hello, Nifas law is the same as Menstruation.

In general, you have to replace fasting during nifas (no need for fidyah). Only if there is a balance that skips Ramadan the next year, pay Fidyah on that balance only.

Text: @acaiijawe Ustaz, nak tanya, bagaimana wanita yg sebelum ini lalai dgn tanggungjawap mengganti puasa dan sekarang nak melakukan yang sepatutnya? Bagaimana kiraannya?
Translated Text: @acaiijawe Ustaz, I want to ask, how can a woman who was negligent in her responsibility replace fasting and now wants to do what she should? How does it count?

Text:
@ariel_coco Kena bertaubat sebab tinggalkan kewajipan puasa tersebut. Buat anggaran puasa yang ditinggalkan. Cuba gantikan semampunya.

Setiap kali melangkau Ramadan, keluarkan fidyah atas jumlah yang belum bayar. Kalau dah berusia/sakit, tidak perlu ganti. Bayar fidyah sahaja.
Translated Text:
@ariel_coco Had to repent for leaving the obligation of fasting. Make an estimate of the missed fast. Try to replace as much as possible.

Every time you skip Ramadan, pay fidyah for the unpaid amount. If you are old/sick, you don't need to replace it. Pay fidyah only.

Translated Text: @nrsyxhira_ @nnatashaputerii If there is no other way, just pay fidyah. Because it is considered infirm which endangers life if left. But the best thing is to ask a doctor for advice first.

Jika tidak sempat gantikan, barulah Fidyah dikenakan.

Text:
Antara sebab tak minat ulas tentang politik, kerana terdedah setiap hari dengan ancaman Allah dan Nabi ini.

Tak berbaloi termasuk dalam golongan itu dan merisikokan hari akhirat kita.

Semoga Allah ampuni dosa kita semua dan masukkan kita ke dalam syurga, Ameen!
Translated Text:
One of the reasons for not being interested in commenting on politics is because I am exposed every day to the threat of God and the Prophet.

It is not worth being included in that group and risking our afterlife.

May Allah forgive all our sins and enter us into heaven, Ameen!

Text:
Tiba-tiba rindu suasana rewang dan kesibukan majlis kahwin.

Jumpa saudara mara, orang kampung, kawan-kawan. Riuh rendah kanak-kanak bermain dan gurauan semasa rewang.

Mungkin tak boleh buat kenduri kahwin begini lagi untuk beberapa tahun akan datang.
Translated Text:
I suddenly miss the rewang atmosphere and the hustle and bustle of weddings.

See relatives, villagers, friends. Noisy children playing and joking during rewang.

Maybe we won't be able to hold a wedding like this again for the next few years.

Text:
Sebenarnya memang ada banyak asnaf yang bermasalah begini. Kalau tengok bantuan yang diberi, mesti korang terkejut jumlahnya.

Ada yang duduk rumah free zakat bayarkan sewa. Asyik gaduh dengan jiran & curi barang kawasan kejiranan.

Mana tak kena halau. Zakat juga dipersalahkan.
Translated Text:
Actually, there are many asnaf who have this problem. If you look at the help given, you must be surprised at the amount.

There are those who sit at home free of zakat and pay rent. Have fun arguing with the neighbors & steal neighborhood items.

Where should not be driven away. Zakat is also blamed.

Text:
Ada yang sampai 2-3 kawasan perumahan zakat carikan rumah sewa. Semuanya timbulkan masalah. Rosakkan rumah orang. Jual barang tuan rumah 💆🏻‍♂️.

Selalunya mereka ada masalah dadah, arak & jenayah.

Tapi itulah, memang akhirnya institusi zakat juga dipersalahkan.
Translated Text:
There are even 2-3 zakat housing areas looking for a rental house. Everything causes problems. Destroy people's houses. Selling host items 💆🏻‍♂️.

Often they have problems with drugs, alcohol & crime.

But that's it, in the end the zakat institution is also blamed.

Text:
Bila ada masalah dadah, biasanya memang sedaya upaya tak bagi bantuan wang tunai.

Kita bagi sewa rumah, support semua anak sekolah, bantuan makanan, bayarkan api air dsb.

Basic selesai. Mereka sihat tubuh badan kena kerja. Bukan zakat nak support 100% dan mereka goyang kaki.
Translated Text:
When there is a drug problem, usually every effort is made not to give cash assistance.

We provide house rent, support for all school children, food assistance, pay electricity, water, etc.

Basic is done. They are healthy and have to work. It is not zakat to support 100% and they shake their feet.

Text:
Tapi soalan orang awam & wartawan biasanya kalau jumpa asnaf atau orang susah,

“Berapa RM zakat bagi sebulan?”

Mereka pun jawab RM150 sebulan.

Habis netizen kecam. Zakat kejam bagi duit sikit. Nak makan apa?! Padahal jumlah bantuan sebenar diterima >RM1500 sebulan.

Itulah.
Translated Text:
But public questions & journalists usually if they meet a poor person or a poor person,

"How much RM zakat for a month?"

They answered RM150 a month.

After the netizens criticized. Zakat is cruel for a little money. What do you want to eat?! Although the actual amount of aid received is >RM1500 per month.

That's it.

Text: @acaiijawe Salam ustaz, maaf kalau soalan noob. Do zakat share information with ngo on what they provide to these asnaf? I mean like if terlalu banyak bantuan on the same people. Parah ustaz. Lebih baik kalau ngo boleh focus kepada golongan yang tercicir dan sbgnya.
Translated Text: @acaiijawe Greetings teacher, sorry if it's a noob question. Do zakat share information with ngo on what they provide to these asnaf? I mean like if too much help on the same people. Bad teacher. It is better if ngo can focus on the dropout group and the like.

Text:
@hanafi_nasri Data Asnaf ni tertakluk kepada PDPA. Jadi tidak boleh berikan sesuka hati melainkan ada permohonan rasmi.

Memang ini masalah yang selalu terjadi. Sebab itu kelebihan yang bayar di institusi. NGO yang bekerjasama rapat dengan zakat, biasanya maklum perkara ini.
Translated Text:
@hanafi_nasri This Asnaf data is subject to PDPA. So it cannot be given at will unless there is an official application.

This is a problem that always happens. That's why it's an advantage that pays in institutions. NGOs that work closely with zakat are usually aware of this.

Text:
@acaiijawe @HilalAsyraf Yg penerima zakat ni bukan saja ada yg miskin harta. Tapi ada juga yg miskin akhlak.

Tp yg pelik bila netizen kita bila nampak org miskin terus sibuk cari salah org lain. Bkn nak hulur bantuan pun, tahu kondem je.
Translated Text:
@acaiijawe @HilalAsyraf The recipients of this zakat are not only the poor. But there are also poor morals.

But the strange thing is when our netizens, when they see poor people, keep busy looking for other people's fault. I don't even want to offer help, I know condoms.

Text: @acaiijawe Cc @ImanQurrotuaini tengok lah sikap asnaf ni ustazah. Dah macam macam bantuan di beri tapi still buat perangai dengan jiran, kaki botol yang tak tahan tu. Bak kata ustaz, Zakat jugak yang dipersalahkan.

Text: @acaiijawe Lagi 1 yg aku perasan klu ada ngo bagi derma atau sumbangan, byk org persoalkan mana bantuan zakat? Walhal xde kaitan pun bantuan ngo2 tu dgn bantuan dari zakat. Cuba ubah persepsi mcm ni.

Text: @acaiijawe Sbb usually org yg miskin ni ade dua jenis. Ada yg miskin harta, kaya jiwa. Ada yg miskin harta, miskin jiwa. Jd yg miskin kedua2nya mmg tak cukup bantu satu shj tp itulah hakikatnya mmg ramai miskin tak dpt dibantu apabila miskin jiwa.
Translated Text: @acaiijawe Because usually there are two types of poor people. Some are poor in wealth, rich in soul. There are those who are poor in property, poor in spirit. So the two poor people are not enough to help just one but that is the fact that many poor people cannot be helped when they are poor in spirit.

Text: @acaiijawe Ada kawan sekolah kakak saya ibu tunggal anak 2.  Anak ke 2 dia OKU kategori  mental(gila bulan) Fizikal semua sempurna. Gila dia teruk seperti kena rasuk berminggu bila hari bulan mengambang.  Pasti  dia buat perangai meracau menjerit dan buat bising mengamuk.

He must have been shouting and making a lot of noise.

Text: @acaiijawe Dia dapat bantuan pihak baitulmal  bagi bantuan bulanan dan bayar sewa rumah. Tapi itulah semua jiran terpaksa halau dia dari rumah sewa. Kerana tidak tahan. Beribu tempat dia tinggal dan berpindah randah di usir kerana masalah anak, bukan masalah tak bayar sewa.

Thousands of places where he lived and moved were evicted because of child problems, not because of non-payment of rent.

Text: @acaiijawe Orang salah faham  dan tidak tahu. Orang salah kan pihak zakat,  baitulmal dan kerajaan tidak bantu. . NGO pembangkang pula tokoh tambah cerita jadi isu panas.  Adusss.
Translated Text: @acaiijawe People misunderstand and don't know. It is the fault of the zakat, Baitulmal and the government for not helping. . The opposition NGO is a figure who adds to the story and becomes a hot issue. Adusss.

Text:
Jika bisnes tersebut bersifat part-time/freelance (ada kerja bergaji), maka taksiran tu boleh digabungkan je dengan gaji dalam Zakat Pendapatan.

Jika perniagaan tersebut dibuat sepenuh masa, maka taksiran dibuat secara tunggal atas nama Zakat Perniagaan.
Translated Text:
If the business is part-time/freelance (paid work), then the assessment can be combined with the salary in Income Zakat.

If the business is made full-time, then the assessment is made solely in the name of Business Zakat.

Text:
Kiraan ni juga boleh digunakan untuk bisnes2 kecil lain.

Berniaga nasi lemak tepi jalan, jual tudung online, jual baju raya, chocojar, mesin kopi, brownies dsb.

Tapi kalau bisnes besar yang ada Penyata Untung Rugi & Audit semua tu kiraannya berbeza sikit. Insyaallah next time.
Translated Text:
This count can also be used for other small businesses.

Trading nasi lemak on the side of the road, selling tudung online, selling Raya clothes, chocojars, coffee machines, brownies etc.

But if it's a big business that has a Profit and Loss Statement & All the audits are slightly different. God willing, next time.

Text:
*Update FAQ.

Kalau bisnes part-time yang tidak kira duit keluar-masuk bagaimana nak kira zakat?

Buat anggaran. Sebab orang lain pun tidak tahu berapa anda untung. Dapat satu figure, lebihkan sedikit supaya lebih yakin.

Akan datang, kena catat untung supaya mudah kira zakat.
Translated Text:
*Update FAQ.

If it's a part-time business that doesn't count incoming and outgoing money, how do you calculate zakat?

Make an estimate. Because other people don't even know how much you profit. Get a figure, add a little more to be more confident.

In the future, have to record the profit so that it is easy to calculate zakat.

Text:
Jika saya buat bisnes kecil2an di universiti, adakah kena zakat?

Ya. Jika cukup syarat.

Hatta jika kenak-kanak, orang tua dan asnaf fakir miskin yang berniaga pun wajib bayar zakat jika mencukupi haul dan nisab.

https://t.co/Emlafu5gCX
Translated Text:
If I do a small business at the university, do I have to pay zakat?

Yes. If enough conditions.

Even if children, the elderly and the poor asnaf who do business are also obliged to pay zakat if they have sufficient haul and nisab.

https://t.co/Emlafu5gCX

Text:
Adakah perlu asingkan duit Zakat Perniagaan dan Zakat Pendapatan masa nak bayar zakat?

Tidak perlu.

Semua tu termasuk dalam harta kita. Contohnya, kalau anda kena zakat perniagaan, anda bayar guna duit gaji pun boleh takde masalah.

Termasuk semua zakat-zakat lain.
Translated Text:
Is it necessary to separate Business Zakat and Income Zakat when paying zakat?

No need.

All that is included in our property. For example, if you have business zakat, you can pay using your salary money without any problem.

Including all other zakat.

Text:
Saya pemandu GRAB/FOOD PANDA separuh masa. Bagaimana nak kira zakat?

[Semua pendapatan (upah + tips)] - kos lain (minyak motor + maintenance) = Hasil Bersih.

Masukkan dalam kiraan zakat pendapatan tahunan kita.

Atau

Hasil Bersih x 2.5%.
Translated Text:
I am a part-time GRAB/FOOD PANDA driver. How to calculate zakat?

[All income (wages + tips)] - other costs (motor oil + maintenance) = Net Income.

Include it in the calculation of zakat of our annual income.

Or

Net Income x 2.5%.

Text: @acaiijawe Saya start dropship bulan 9 tahun lepas. Tapi saya bayar zakat every month dengan hasil dropship tu dalam 20-30 ringgit sebab tak pandai kira. 😅 Tapi memang kena tunggu setahun dulu eh?
Translated Text: @acaiijawe I started dropship on the 9th of last year. But I pay zakat every month with the dropship results in 20-30 ringgit because I don't know how to count. 😅 But do you have to wait a year first?

Text:
@ZehaNoor Zakat memang dikira apabila cukup haul (setahun). Cuma, jika income consistent dan tetap, boleh tahu anggaran income setahun, boleh buat kiraan zakat dah.

Untuk zakat perniagaan, saya cadangkan keluarkan bila cukup Haul kita.
Translated Text:
@ZehaNoor Zakat is indeed calculated when there is enough haul (a year). Only, if the income is consistent and fixed, you can know the annual income estimate, you can calculate the zakat.

For business zakat, I suggest taking out when our Haul is enough.

Text: @acaiijawe @Jo_Rahim Tuan, kalau saya nk bayar sekali zakat pendapatan bekerja & juga zakat online business boleh ke? Ke kena bayar asing-asing?
Translated Text: @acaiijawe @Jo_Rahim Sir, if I want to pay zakat once on work income & Is online business zakat also possible? Do you have to pay foreigners?

Text:
@_zelhanapi @Jo_Rahim Boleh bayar terus sekali tuan.

Untuk semua zakat lain, sebaiknya kita samakan tahun haul. Supaya bila sampai je tarikh yang ditetapkan tu, kita keluarkan semua zakat harta kita (income, bisnes, emas, saham, saving, investment dll).
Translated Text:
@_zelhanapi @Jo_Rahim Can pay directly sir.

For all other zakat, we should make the haul year equal. So that when we reach the set date, we pay out all the zakat of our property (income, business, gold, shares, savings, investment, etc.).

Text: @acaiijawe sy hsewife & berniaga kecil2, jual kuih. Buat sama2 dgn husband.Adelah untung sebulan tu dlm 200 + lps tolak modal,dan mmg husband bg duit tu dkt sy. Kadang sy simpan, tp ade masa duit tu sy guna beli keperluan rumah,kdg bg mak ayah. Mcm tu sy kene byr zakat jugak ke?
Translated Text: @acaiijawe sy hsewife & small business, selling cakes. Do the same with my husband. It's a month's profit of 200 + lps minus the capital, and even my husband gives me that money. Sometimes I save it, but there are times when I use that money to buy things for the house, for my parents. How do you pay zakat here?

Text:
@nhmm_16 Kalau perniagaan itu cuma satu-satunya pekerjaan, maka ia dah masuk Zakat Pendapatan puan.

Jadi kena buat tolakan asas dalam kiraan Zakat. Biasanya memang tidak dikenakan zakat jika untung bersih (lepas tolak perbelanjaan) tidak lebih dari RM2.5k.
Translated Text:
@nhmm_16 If the business is just the only job, then it is included in Income Zakat ma'am.

So you have to make a basic deduction in the calculation of Zakat. Normally, zakat is not charged if the net profit (after deducting expenses) is not more than RM2.5k.

Text:
Emak kudung sebelah kaki.
Ingatan tak berapa baik.
Guna lampin dewasa.
Berkerusi roda.

Anaknya tinggalkan kat tepi jalan malam-malam sebab tak mampu jaga.

Tapi emak ni, masih lagi puji dan doakan anaknya. “Anak acik baik orangnya..” 😭.

Kejam dan zalim aniaya mak sendiri.
Translated Text:
My mother has one foot.
Memory is not very good.
Use adult diapers.
In a wheelchair.

He left his son on the side of the road at night because he couldn't take care of him.

But this mother still praises and prays for her son. "My son is a good person.." 😭.

Mother's own cruel and cruel persecution.

Text:
Emak yang lahirkan kita dengan kesakitan dan kepayahan. Tidak tidur malam jaga masa kita kecil, pujuk bila kita menangis, masak makanan kegemaran bila kita lapar dan uruskan kita dari bayi sampai dewasa.

Dah besar, sampai hati letakkan beliau kat tepi jalan?!

Aduhai.
Translated Text:
The mother who gave birth to us with pain and hardship. Don't sleep at night, take care of us when we are little, comfort us when we cry, cook our favorite food when we are hungry and take care of us from infancy to adulthood.

It's so big, until you put him on the side of the road?!

Alas.

Text:
Taraf ibu dalam Islam ni sangat tinggi. Ia mudahkan kita untuk masuk ke syurga jika berbakti kepada mereka.

Pada mereka ada kemustajaban doa untuk hidup kita.

Dalam Al-Quran & banyak hadis sahih suruh berbuat baik kepada ibu bapa. Uwais al-Qarani dimuliakan kerana jaga ibunya.
Translated Text:
The status of mothers in Islam is very high. It makes it easier for us to enter heaven if we are devoted to them.

They have the power of prayer for our lives.

In the Quran & Many authentic hadiths say to do good to parents. Uwais al-Qarani was honored for taking care of his mother.

Text:

Text:
Orang normal akan fikir begini. Mungkin sebab kita masih muda, bukan asnaf, tak besar tanggungan dsb.

Tapi bila satu hari nanti, anda sebenarnya ada hak bernilai RM300,000 dari harta faraid dan perlukan duit,

Haaa kat situ barulah teruji adakah benar korang tidak tamak harta.
Translated Text:
A normal person would think this way. Maybe it's because we're still young, we're not workers, we don't have a lot of responsibilities, etc.

But if one day, you actually have rights worth RM300,000 from the faraid property and need money,

Haaa, that's where you'll be tested if it's true that you're not greedy for wealth.

Text:
Adakah korang akan lepaskan hak RM300k yang sah dari sudut agama dan legal? 

Masa kerja mahkamah syariah dulu, inilah yang banyak berlaku. Terutama dari keluarga berharta.

Bahagian Faraid je lebih RM1 juta.

Kalau cakap ketika tidak diuji biasanya lebih senang. Moga dijauhkan.
Translated Text:
Are you going to give up the right to RM300k which is valid from a religious and legal point of view?

When the sharia court was working, this is what happened a lot. Especially from wealthy families.

Faraid's share is more than RM1 million.

If you say when you are not tested it is usually easier. May it be kept away.

Text:
Aku perasan, banyak jadi masalah faraid ni bila semasa hidup hubungan adik beradik memang tidak baik.

Gaduh dan dengki. Ia diteruskan sampai ke mati.

Ada kes yang abang betul-betul jaga kebajikan adik beradik dia yang susah. Bila dia mati, adik beradiknya lepaskan hak.

Itulah.
Translated Text:
I have noticed that there are many problems with this farid when the relationship between siblings is not good.

Angry and jealous. It continues until death.

There are cases where my brother really takes care of the welfare of his siblings who are in trouble. When he dies, his siblings release the rights.

That's it.

Text: @acaiijawe Nope. Sure not. Kwn saya harta tanah felda. Adik beradik tiri, seorang lelaki kaya raya. Tetap nak tuntut hasil sawit yg dibahagi faraid. Dapatlah ratus ringgit sebulan. Dia sekali mkn he habis duit tu. Pun nak tuntut
Translated Text: @acaiijawe Nope. Sure not. My husband is felda real estate. Step brother, a wealthy man. Still want to claim the palm oil that is distributed by farid. Get a hundred ringgit a month. Once he eats, he runs out of money. Even want to demand

Text: @acaiijawe Harta faraid datang dengan tanggungjawab, tang duit nak semua, tang tanggungjawab lari semua. aduuhhh...
Translated Text: @acaiijawe Faraid's wealth comes with responsibilities, everyone wants money, all responsibilities run away. awwhhh...

Text: @ZahranKhudzari Ini faraid kefahaman orang melayu kita. Sedih tapi ia realiti.
Translated Text: @ZahranKhudzari This is the understanding of our Malay people. Sad but it's reality.

Text: @acaiijawe Kita belum teruji usahlah mudah berkata mampu hadapi. Kadang baru diuji sedikit masalah sudah mengeluh.
Translated Text: @acaiijawe We haven't been tested, don't easily say we can handle it. Sometimes just tested a little problem already complained.

Text:
@ilmaR_naifoS Betul tuan. Bayangkan tengah hadapi masalah kewangan, tahu ada bahagian dan hak dia bernilai RM100k.

Masa tu ujian bermula.
Translated Text:
@ilmaR_naifoS That's right sir. Imagine facing a financial problem, knowing that his share and rights are worth RM100k.

That's when the test started.

Text: @acaiijawe First advice is, lawyered up. Then the spouse always tuntut hak sepencarian.  Kalau spouse bekerja, court boleh approve sampai 50% of harta arwah for the spouse. Kalau tak bekerja, at least boleh dapat up to 30%. This is valid for mahkamah syariah. But please have a lawyer.
Translated Text: @acaiijawe First advice is, lawyered up. Then the spouse always demands search rights. If the spouse is employed, the court may approve up to 50% of the deceased's estate for the spouse. If it doesn't work, at least you can get up to 30%. This is valid for sharia courts. But please have a lawyer.

Text:
@Cykrow Couldn't agree more on this 😊👍.

Ia bantu mudahkan proses bagi yang tidak tahu.
Translated Text:
@Cykrow Couldn't agree more on this 😊👍.

He helps ease the process for those who don't know.

Text: @acaiijawe Persoalan saya: antara yg berhak menerima faraid ini adalah org yg bertanggungjawab menjaga kebajikan balu & anak-anak. Jadi jika dijual rumah anak2 utk dapatkan duit, bukannya dia perlu keluarkan duit sama juga akhirnya utk menempatkan keluarga tu?
Translated Text: @acaiijawe My question: those who are entitled to receive this faraid are the people who are responsible for taking care of the welfare of widows & children. So if the children's house is sold to get money, doesn't he have to spend the same money in the end to house the family?

Text: @acaiijawe Tumpang tanya. Kalau suami mualaf, faraid semua jatuh kpd isteri & anak2 shj, betul tak?
Translated Text: @acaiijawe Ride to ask. If the husband converts, faraid all fall to the wife & only children, right?

Text:
@shiqin9292 Kalau Muallaf ni tengok keadaan. Biasanya ada juga bahagian untuk Baitulmal jika bahagian istrri dan anak telah tertunai.

Beliau juga boleh bagi wasiat 1/3 atau hibah untuk keluarganya yang bukan Islam.
Translated Text:
@shiqin9292 If this Muallaf looks at the situation. Usually there is also a share for Baitulmal if the share of the wife and children has been paid.

He can also bequeath 1/3 or grant to his non-Muslim family.

Text: @acaiijawe nak tanya kalau ibu bapa nak bagi hibah contohnya rumah perlukah persetujuan semua adik beradik? ade 1 orang adik beradik kandung dan ada adik beradik seibu dan adik beradik sebapa?
Translated Text: @acaiijawe would like to ask if parents want to give a grant, for example a house, do they need the consent of all siblings? do you have 1 biological sibling and there are siblings on the mother's side and siblings on the father's side?

Text:
@acaiijawe Tuan, macamana kita nak tahu tentangan terhadap kita adalah dari golongan yg benar atau tak benar?

Contohnya kalau saya perjuangkan seks bebas (na'udzubillahuminzalik), saya akan dapat pelbagai tentangan. Apa yg akan stop sy utk guna  tweet Tuan ini sebagai motivasi saya?
Translated Text:
@acaiijawe Sir, how do we know if the opposition to us is from the right or wrong group?

For example, if I fight for free sex (na'udzubillahuminzalik), I will get a lot of opposition. What will stop me from using this Sir's tweet as my motivation?

Text:
@ibjela Allahuakbar. Nauzubillah orang yang pertahankan dosa ada motivasi nak teruskan kesalahannya tuan.

Niat kita untuk tambah pahala jariah. Benar atau tidak tindakan kita itu neracanya dosa dan pahala dalam Islam sahaja. Bukan ikut logik akal kita semata.
Translated Text:
@ibjela Allahuakbar. Nauzubillah, the person who defends the sin has the motivation to continue the mistake, sir.

Our intention is to increase the reward of charity. Whether our actions are true or not is the balance of sin and reward in Islam alone. Not according to the logic of our mind.

Text:
Kesimpulan ringkas bila dah join Clubhouse.

Twitter : Membaca.
TikTok : Melihat visual.
Clubhouse : Mendengar.

1. Kalau siapa yang memang sebelum ni suka dengar Podcast/Audiobooks, ini tambahan dari itu.

Banyak topik yang dibincangkan ada kat platform Youtube, Spotify dll. https://t.co/ZRG1lXn9LG
Translated Text:
A brief conclusion when you join Clubhouse.

Twitter : Reading.
TikTok : Looking at the visuals.
Clubhouse : Listening.

1. If anyone likes to listen to Podcasts/Audiobooks before, this is an addition to that.

Many of the topics discussed are on YouTube, Spotify, etc. https://t.co/ZRG1lXn9LG

Text:
2. Kalau orang visual; suka tengok video, fast-pace information (ie TikTok), mungkin akan cepat rasa bosan. Terutama bagi yang attention span rendah.

3. Anda boleh DENGAR orang borak2 selama 1-3 jam tanpa ada sebarang visual, tak boleh tulis/baca komen? Jawapan ini membantu.
Translated Text:
2. If people are visual; likes to watch videos, fast-pace information (ie TikTok), may get bored quickly. Especially for those with a low attention span.

3. You can LISTEN to people chatting for 1-3 hours without any visuals, can't write/read comments? This answer helps.

Text:
4. Kalau perbahasan tu ilmiah dan ringkas, kita dapat manfaat. Kalau tak, cuma dengar orang borak/gaduh meleret-leret selama berjam2 tanpa tujuan.

5. Seperti semua sosial media, kita yang kena pandai pilih room sesuai + moderator bijak untuk bagi manfaat dan ilmu untuk kita.
Translated Text:
4. If the debate is scientific and concise, we can benefit. If not, just listen to people arguing/fighting for hours on end.

5. Like all social media, we are the ones who have to choose the right room + smart moderator to share benefits and knowledge for us.

Text:
6. Tapi sebab ia hype, Facebook pun bakal copy apps ni. Tengok bagaimana mereka bersaing nanti.

Kesimpulannya, Audio chat sebenarnya bukan untuk semua. Jadi tak perlu rasa FOMO dengan Clubhouse.

Kalau ilmu yang dicari, platform sedia ada pun kita belum manfaatkan sepenuhnya✌️. https://t.co/kvfB3ragrd
Translated Text:
6. But because it's hype, even Facebook will copy these apps. See how they compete later.

In conclusion, Audio chat is actually not for everyone. So there's no need to feel FOMO with Clubhouse.

If the knowledge is sought, we have not fully utilized the existing platform✌️. https://t.co/kvfB3ragrd

Text:
Masa tengah fit & semangat berlari dulu sepanjang tahun penuh dgn event larian. Duit habis beribu-ribu.

Bangun 3-4 pagi untuk join lari marathon. Subuh atas jalan raya 😭.

Tapi zaman tu dah berlalu. Semuanya kena bersederhana. Tujuan bersenam untuk sihat sekarang lebih jelas.
Translated Text:
Middle time fit & the spirit of running first throughout the year is full of running events. Thousands of money.

Wake up 3-4 in the morning to join the marathon. Dawn on the road 😭.

But that time has passed. Everything has to be simple. The purpose of exercising to be healthy is now clearer.

Text:
Pendosa macam kita semua ni sangat perlukan Ramadan untuk dapatkan pahala berganda.

Jadi sepanjang bulan Rejab dan Syaaban, kita digalakkan untuk berdoa :

"Ya Allah, berkatilah kami semua pada bulan Rejab dan Syaaban. Panjangkan usia kami untuk sampai ke bulan Ramadan".

Ameen!
Translated Text:
Sinners like us all really need Ramadan to get double rewards.

So throughout the months of Rajab and Shaaban, we are encouraged to pray:

"Oh God, bless us all in the months of Rajab and Shaaban. Extend our lives to reach the month of Ramadan".

Amen!

Text: @acaiijawe Amat byk dah tersebar dalam wasap grup.
Translated Text: @acaiijawe A lot has spread in the wasap group.

Text:
Semoga Allah beri ganjaran besar kepada Ustaz EL dan team yang terlibat.

Sebab ada yang TUDUH institusi zakat tak bantu,

Aku nak kongsi SETIAP TAHUN, 9,000 pelajar ditaja sepenuhnya oleh zakat.

Ini TIDAK termasuk Zakat Fisabilillah (one-off) seramai >20,000 orang. https://t.co/yD9eNK8Cra
Translated Text:
May God give a great reward to Ustaz EL and the team involved.

Because some accuse the zakat institution of not helping,

I want to share EVERY YEAR, 9,000 students are fully sponsored by zakat.

This does NOT include Zakat Fisabilillah (one-off) for >20,000 people. https://t.co/yD9eNK8Cra

Text:
Untuk Bantuan Pendidikan sahaja, lebih RM100 juta diagihkan kepada pelajar.

Setiap tahun.

Kenapa tinggi sangat agihan untuk pendidikan?

Sebab zakat percaya, generasi kedua inilah yang bakal mengubah nasib keluarga mereka untuk keluar dari kepompong kemiskinan. https://t.co/1fZ87tTp6Y
Translated Text:
For Education Aid alone, more than RM100 million was distributed to students.

Annually.

Why is the distribution for education so high?

Because zakat believes, it is the second generation that will change the fate of their family to get out of the cocoon of poverty. https://t.co/1fZ87tTp6Y

Text:
Sekarang ada ramai students Medic di kalangan anak Asnaf yang dah berkhidmat sebagai doktor sejak 10-15 tahun lepas, Alhamdulillah.

Kos pengajian merek ada lebih RM100k seorang.

Kesimpulannya, kalau anda tidak tahu sesuatu maklumat, tidak semestinya ia tidak wujud.

Itulah.
Translated Text:
Now there are many Medic students among Asnaf's children who have been serving as doctors for the past 10-15 years, Alhamdulillah.

The cost of studying brands is over RM100k per person.

In conclusion, if you don't know something, it doesn't mean it doesn't exist.

That's it.

Text:
Basmi kemiskinan tanggungjawab bersama, bukan nak tunjuk siapa yang paling hebat.

Setiap kita mainkan peranan dalam masyarakat. Ustaz Ebit Liew sedang jalankan t/jwb beliau. Kita jugakena bantu ikut kepakaran kita.

Kalau tak dapat bantu, jangan jadi batu api lagakan orang lain!
Translated Text:
Eradicating poverty is a shared responsibility, not to show who is the greatest.

Each of us plays a role in society. Ustaz Ebit Liew is running his t/wb. We also have to help with our expertise.

If you can't help, don't be someone else's flint!

😊😊😊

Text:
2. Contoh, nampak rumah besar, tapi suami mati mengejut (kemalangan, jantung, kanser). Tiada sumber pendapatan lain sebab isteri suri rumah + anak ramai.

3. Bila mati, dengan MRTT, rumah tu dapat kat waris. Maksudnya rumah dah jadi milik mereka tapi tiada duit nak makan/hidup.
Translated Text:
2. For example, it looks like a big house, but the husband died suddenly (accident, heart, cancer). There is no other source of income because the wife is a housewife + many children.

3. When you die, with MRTT, the house goes to the heirs. It means that the house belongs to them but they have no money to eat/live.

Text:
4. Takkanlah kita nak suruh isteri jual rumah (yang dah bebas hutang bank) dan minta mereka keluar menyewa.

5. Sekurang-kurangnya keperluan asas tempat tinggal yang selesa dan selamat untuk keluarga ini telah selesai. Tak perlu pindah ke sana sini.
Translated Text:
4. We don't want to tell the wife to sell the house (which is free of bank debt) and ask them to go out and rent.

5. At least the basic needs of a comfortable and safe place to live for this family have been completed. No need to move here and there.

Text:
6. Ini yang banyak sangat terjadi. Kadangkala ia menimbulkan fitnah bagi orang yang tak tahu.

7. Kita bantu sampai anak-anak mereka besar dan berpelajaran, seteruskan keluarkan family mereka dari kemiskinan.

8. Anak dari keluarga yang tiba-tiba jatuh miskin ni, biasanya bijak.
Translated Text:
6. This happens a lot. Sometimes it causes slander for people who don't know.

7. We help until their children are grown up and educated, and continue to lift their families out of poverty.

8. Children from families that suddenly fell into poverty are usually smart.

Text:
9. Anak asnaf yang dapat straight A dalam PMR, SPM, STPM dan dapat 4 flat ketika degree biasanya datang dari group ini.

Kesimpulannya, bila nampak kes begitu, jangan fitnah bukan-bukan. Anda tidak tahu apa yang mereka telah hadapi hingga jatuh miskin.

Itulah.
Translated Text:
9. Asnaf children who get straight A's in PMR, SPM, STPM and get 4 flats during the degree usually come from this group.

In conclusion, if you see such a case, don't slander. You don't know what they have faced to fall into poverty.

That's it.

Text:
Pada aku orang makin tak nampak bantuan zakat, sebab zaman sekarang, bantuan terus masuk akaun bank.

- Mereka dapat duit zakat macam gaji. Tinggal cucuk ATM.
- Sewa rumah, terus masuk akaun tuan rumah.
- Dialisis/perubatan. Rawatan mcm free je sebab dah dibayarkan dll.

Itulah.
Translated Text:
I think people don't see zakat aid more and more, because nowadays, aid goes directly into bank accounts.

- They get zakat money like salary. Just poke the ATM.
- Rent a house, directly into the host's account.
- Dialysis/medicine. The treatment is free because it has already been paid for etc.

That's it.

Text:
Bila masuk macam gaji di bank, ramai kurang bersyukur.

Ada yang dapat bantuan lebih RM1000 sebulan, tapi bukan main aktif kutuk zakat kat FB (mcmlah tak kenal). 

7 tahun dapat setiap bulan. Tapi sebulan je miss/lambat masuk, mengamuk macam tak dibayar gaji. Ini realiti.
Translated Text:
When a salary comes in at the bank, many people are less grateful.

There are people who get help of more than RM1000 a month, but they don't actively curse zakat on FB (I don't know).

7 years get every month. But it's been a month since I missed/arrived late, raged like I wasn't paid. This is reality.

Translated Text: @acaiijawe @HxkxmXhmxd read here. Zakat distribution is not just aid money. Medicine/dialysis, learning Prof. Baitulmal College, Inst. Baitulmal skills, SMAIWP, SMISTA for tahfiz, Picoms Nursing College, Mosques in KL, Darul Hidayah converts, Darul Kifayah for orphans, Darussaadah again.

Text:
1. Beli GPS @ Cellular version?

Jangan terpengaruh org lain. Kalau 95% masa phone sentiasa di sisi, tak perlu cellular version.

Dengar music masa lari?
GPS pun boleh (download).

Call ketika bersenam?
10/10 takkan guna.

Guna 4 bulan, terminate plan.
Jimat RM18 sebulan (eSIM). https://t.co/u5z3l8MjH9
Translated Text:
1. Buy GPS @ Cellular version?

Do not be influenced by other people. If 95% of the time the phone is always at your side, you don't need a cellular version.

Listen to music while running?
GPS can also be downloaded.

Call when exercising?
10/10 will not use.

Use 4 months, terminate plan.
Save RM18 per month (eSIM). https://t.co/u5z3l8MjH9

Text:
2. Perlu Always On Display (AOD) ke tak?

Depends. Jujurnya ia membantu. Tak perlu angkat tangan nak lihat jam.

Contoh tengah typing di laptop, kita boleh jeling je instead angkat tangan, pusing atau tap untuk wake-up jam.

Hanya AW version 5 dan 6 yang support AOD. https://t.co/Yd6mGhm1wx
Translated Text:
2. Do you need Always On Display (AOD)?

It depends. Honestly it helps. No need to raise your hand to see the clock.

For example, in the middle of typing on a laptop, we can just stare instead of raising our hands, turning or tapping for the wake-up clock.

Only AW version 5 and 6 support AOD. https://t.co/Yd6mGhm1wx

Text:
3. Ketahanan Battery?

Bila pakai smartwatch ni memang kena expect sama seperti phone. Jenis rutin kena cas setiap hari.

Memanglah boleh tahan sampai masuk hari ke-2. Tapi takkan nak tunggu 0% baru cas. Biasa cas di meja ketika kerja.

Jam Garmin Fenix aku, seminggu sekali cas. https://t.co/FqBPMxxd25
Translated Text:
3. Battery life?

When using a smartwatch, you have to expect the same as a phone. The routine type has to be charged every day.

It can hold until the 2nd day. But I don't want to wait for 0% to charge. Usually charge at the desk when working.

My Garmin Fenix ​​watch, charged once a week. https://t.co/FqBPMxxd25

Text:
4. Quality & Performance?

Jujurnya, AW series 4,5,6 hampir tiada beza ketika digunakan. Performance hampir sama + design identical.

Hatta sapa yang pakai version 3 (2017) pun masih okay lagi.

Ini jam. Bukan korang nak main games atau buat editing video kat jam.
Translated Text:
4. Quality & Performance?

To be honest, the AW series 4,5,6 are almost no different when used. Performance is almost the same + identical design.

Even those who use version 3 (2017) are still okay.

It's clock. Don't you want to play games or do video editing at the clock.

Text:
5. Aluminium vs Ceramic/Stainless Steel?

Ada duit boleh je beli. Luaran sama, cuma ia lebih berat dan tahan calar. Bila dah pakai kat tangan sama je.

Lagipun ramai guna case untuk protect jam mereka.

Pertama kali dalam dunia orang guna case kat jam. Mengarut! Termasuklah aku. https://t.co/tLf8K2bMkQ
Translated Text:
5. Aluminum vs Ceramic/Stainless Steel?

If you have money, you can buy it. The exterior is the same, only it's heavier and scratch resistant. When you use it on your hand, it's the same.

After all, many people use cases to protect their watches.

For the first time in the world people use watch cases. Nonsense! Including me. https://t.co/tLf8K2bMkQ

Text:
Lain-lain.

6. Kalau guna iPhone, AW lebih logik dipilih sebab sync ecosystem. Tapi smartwatch lain pun boleh guna tanpa masalah. Perlukan companion apps.

7. Notification boleh pilih nak mirror iPhone atau tak. Aku punya noti cuma untuk Call, SMS dan IMAN Apps (solat) je. https://t.co/DT9Qc5bMCX
Translated Text:
Others.

6. If you use an iPhone, AW is more logical to choose because of the sync ecosystem. But other smartwatches can also be used without problems. Need companion apps.

7. Notification can choose to mirror iPhone or not. I have notes only for Call, SMS and IMAN Apps (prayer). https://t.co/DT9Qc5bMCX

Text:
8. AW default face takde yang kira STEP dan rekod Deep Sleep ketika tidur. Benda basic yang aku rasa semua smartwatch lain ada.

Tapi boleh download apps lain. Majoriti berbayar.

Kelebihan AW terbesar adalah sokongan banyak developer. Banyak Apps khusus direka untuk AW. https://t.co/Uto2pBkVLK
Translated Text:
8. There is no AW default face that calculates STEP and records Deep Sleep when sleeping. Basic things that I think all other smartwatches have.

But you can download other apps. The majority are paid.

The biggest advantage of AW is the support of many developers. Many Apps are specifically designed for AW. https://t.co/Uto2pBkVLK

Text:
9. AW di Malaysia masih tak boleh gunakan Apple Pay. Ini paling mengarut dan kesian.

Features ada (termasuk dlm harga belian), tapi tak boleh guna sebab takde bank support.

Jeles betul tengok yang pakai Samsung Watch bayar kat kedai guna jam. 2029 agaknya baru ada kat sini. https://t.co/5H28v6uUSu
Translated Text:
9. AW in Malaysia still cannot use Apple Pay. This is the most ridiculous and pathetic.

Features are there (included in the purchase price), but cannot be used because there is no bank support.

It's really clear to see who uses a Samsung Watch and pays at the watch store. 2029 seems to be new here. https://t.co/5H28v6uUSu

Text:
10. AW series 5 dan 6 ada features ECG.

Iaitu check keadaan jantung sama ada normal atau ada tanda atrial fibrillation. Sekali lagi, ia tak ada di Malaysia.

Tapi kalau jalan ke Singapore/Thailand boleh activekan ECG. Bila balik sini benda tu available sepanjang masa. https://t.co/vnOXxhEAs0
Translated Text:
10. AW series 5 and 6 have ECG features.

That is, check the condition of the heart whether it is normal or there are signs of atrial fibrillation. Again, it is not available in Malaysia.

But if you go to Singapore/Thailand, you can activate the ECG. When you come back here, that thing is available all the time. https://t.co/vnOXxhEAs0

Text:
Kesimpulan.

Tujuan utama aku beli AW ni untuk Health & Fitness.

Ia bantu untuk kita kekal aktif setiap hari. Ada target dan motivasi untuk capai.

Bila lama sangat duduk, dia ingatkan suruh berdiri. Bila tak aktif dia suruh keluar buat aktiviti. Kadang2 dia suruh bernafas😭. https://t.co/SgU5e3BEV8
Translated Text:
Conclusion.

The main purpose I bought this AW for Health & Fitness.

It helps us stay active every day. There are targets and motivation to achieve.

If you sit for a long time, he reminds you to stand up. When he is not active, he tells him to go out for activities. Sometimes he tells me to breathe😭. https://t.co/SgU5e3BEV8

Text:
Fungsi kesihatan macam monitor heart rate dan ECG sebenarnya membantu. Kalau ada yang abnormal, kita tahu lebih awal.

Ia juga rekod level fitness semasa kita.

Soon dapat check gula dalam darah, tanpa perlu cucuk jarum. Ia satu breakthrough dalam teknologi monitor kesihatan. https://t.co/4pFRFv206y
Translated Text:
Health functions such as heart rate monitor and ECG are actually helpful. If there is something abnormal, we know in advance.

It is also a record of our current fitness level.

Soon you can check your blood sugar, without having to stick a needle. It's a breakthrough in health monitor technology. https://t.co/4pFRFv206y

Text:
AW mungkin paling popular.

Tapi sebenarnya ada banyak lagi smartwatch lain yang bagus dan lebih banyak features dengan harga lebih berbaloi.

Wife guna Samsung Watch Active 2 pair dengan iPhone dia takde masalah. Semua yang AW buat, diapun ada.

Semua data sync tanpa masalah. https://t.co/YY2LUJ0Cqz
Translated Text:
AW is probably the most popular.

But actually there are many other smartwatches that are good and have more features at a more reasonable price.

Wife uses Samsung Watch Active 2 pair with iPhone she has no problem. Everything that AW does, he has.

All data sync without problems. https://t.co/YY2LUJ0Cqz

Text:
Satu lagi kelebihan smartwatch ni kita boleh tukar-tukar strap dengan lebih mudah.

Mungkin perlukan 20 saat je untuk tukar strap jam.

Berbanding jam biasa yang kena gunakan skru halus untuk buka dan pasang.

Jadi boleh sesuaikan dengan keadaan (formal/santai/sport) atau baju. https://t.co/V1KkMLYxmF
Translated Text:
Another advantage of this smartwatch is that we can change the strap more easily.

Maybe it only takes 20 seconds to change the watch strap.

Compared to normal watches that have to use fine screws to open and install.

So can adjust to the situation (formal/casual/sport) or clothes. https://t.co/V1KkMLYxmF

Text:
Akhir sekali. Adakah perlu Apple Watch?

Jujurnya, beli je mana-mana smartwatch yang kita mampu. Mampu AW, silakan.

- Ia bantu kita lebih sihat.
- Galakkan supaya aktif.
- Lari/cycling tak payah bawa phone + dengar audio/ceramah (bluetooth).
- Monitor kesihatan dll. 

End.
Translated Text:
Lastly. Do you need an Apple Watch?

Honestly, just buy any smartwatch we can afford. Can AW, please.

- It helps us to be healthier.
- Encourage to be active.
- Running/cycling without having to bring a phone + listen to audio/speech (bluetooth).
- Health monitor etc.

Text:
Mungkin rezeki yang kita miliki dan kehidupan selesa sekarang adalah berkat dari doa orang lain.

Doa dari orang yang pernah kita tolong & bantu dulu, doa guru-guru kita, doa sahabat-sahabat kita yang soleh dsb.

Mohon doakan kebaikan untuk saya juga.
Translated Text:
Maybe the sustenance we have and a comfortable life now is a blessing from the prayers of others.

Prayers from people we have helped & help first, the prayers of our teachers, the prayers of our pious friends etc.

Please pray for me too.

Text: @acaiijawe @amirahcantik Kadang2 kita bersedekah dan mereka ini berdoa utk kita.

Text:
Free Market kapitalis ni bila menguntungkan orang kaya dia okay. Semua kena ikut rules hatta buat Short Squeeze.

Tapi bila merugikan, mereka akan sedaya upaya halang (dalam kes GameStop ni tak bagi BUY) dengan pelbagai alasan.

Loophole legal yang cuba dihentikan.
Translated Text:
This capitalist free market is okay if it benefits the rich. Everyone has to follow the rules even for Short Squeeze.

But if it is detrimental, they will do their best to prevent (in this case GameStop not for BUY) with various reasons.

Legal loophole that is trying to be stopped.

Text:
Senang cerita, orang 'miskin' ni nak join tak boleh buat benda luar biasa & manipulasi free market (mereka je boleh).

Dulu masa belajar tentang shorting, shares float, share short float, naked short pun pening.

Mujur benda tu haram dan tak popular di Bursa kita.
Translated Text:
Nice story, these 'poor' people who want to join can't do extraordinary things & free market manipulation (they can).

It used to be when I was learning about shorting, shares float, share short float, naked short was dizzying.

Fortunately, that thing is illegal and not popular in our Bursa.

Text:
@acaiijawe If they can't beat you in technicality, they'll beat you in plain reading.

Apa pun, mereka yang menang.
Translated Text:
@acaiijawe If they can't beat you in technicality, they'll beat you in plain reading.

Apa pun, mereka yang menang.

Text: @EigenIicht Exactly. Benda ni sangat berisiko. Orang biasa yang tak faham jangan sesekali join benda camni.
Translated Text: @EigenIicht Exactly. This thing is very risky. Ordinary people who don't understand should never join something like this.

Text:
Orang awam, siapa sahaja yang dia ikut. Selagi orang yang dia ikut itu asatizah/ulama'/ilmuan/majlis fatwa yang dipercayai keilmuannya, diketahui latar belakang pendidikan agamanya,

Maka mereka dah terlepas.

Ini yang dipersepakati ulama' usul dari dulu sampai sekarang.
Translated Text:
Common people, whoever he follows. As long as the person he follows is an asatizah/ulama'/scientist/fatwa council whose knowledge is trusted, whose religious education background is known,

So they missed it.

This is what the scholars of usul have agreed on from the past until now.

Text:
Maksudnya kita hanya perlu ikut guru, fuqaha', ulama yang kita percaya.

Mereka yang habiskan hidupnya untuk belajar Al-Quran, Sunnah dan ilmu2 lain serta sampaikan kepada kita.

Kita PERCAYA ilmunya, kefahamannya, waraknya dan JADIKAN DIA JAWAPAN kita kepada Allah.

Selesai.
Translated Text:
It means that we only have to follow the teachers, fuqaha', scholars that we trust.

Those who spend their lives learning the Quran, Sunnah and other sciences and pass them on to us.

We TRUST his knowledge, his understanding, his healing and MAKE HIM our ANSWER to God.

Finished.

Text:
Kalau nampak orang lain berbeza cara ibadah dan beragama dengan kita?

Mudah. Guru mereka berbeza dengan kita. Elakkan berbalah.

Terutama melibatkan khilaf dalam hukum hakam feqah yang telah diperselisihkan, hatta oleh para sahabat sejak zaman Nabi saw lagi.
Translated Text:
If you see that other people have different ways of worship and religion than us?

Easy. Their teachers are different from us. Avoid arguing.

Especially involving errors in jurisprudence that have been disputed, even by the companions since the time of the Prophet, peace be upon him.

Text:
Kalau nampak asatizah atau pelajar agama yang bergaduh/berdebat dalam masalah agama?

Biarkan je. Sebab mereka tahu apa yang dibincangkan.

Kebanyakkan isu tu pun dah dibincangkan selama beratus-ratus tahun tak selesai.

Orang bijak tahu kadar kemampuan ilmu yang mereka dimiliki.
Translated Text:
If you see asatizah or religious students fighting/debating on religious issues?

Let it be. Because they know what they are talking about.

Most of those issues have been discussed for hundreds of years without being resolved.

Wise people know the level of knowledge they possess.

Text:
Selagi AKIDAH anda betul. Tahu beza Allah dan makhlukNya. Faham Rukun Islam dan Iman.

Tidak syirikkan Allah dengan sesuatu. Buat apa yang disuruh, tinggal yang haram.

Insyaallah selamat bagi orang awam.

Kalau mampu, dalami agama lebih mendalam. Kalau tak, cukup jadi pengikut.
Translated Text:
As long as your FAITH is right. Know the difference between God and His creatures. Understand the Pillars of Islam and Faith.

Do not associate God with something. Do what you are told, stay away from what is illegal.

God willing, it will be safe for the public.

If you can, go deeper into religion. If not, just be a follower.

Text:
Boleh menangis agaknya kalau satu hari nanti bila Covid-19 ini berlalu pergi sepenuhnya, kemudian kita dapat kembali solat berjemaah rapat-rapat semula 😭.

Translated Text:

Text:
Hatta orang yang alim & berpendidikan juga ada banyak kelemahan dan kesilapan.

Hajjaj bin Artah seorang pakar fiqh dan pengeluar fatwa di Kufah & Basra, Iraq.

Beliau tinggalkan solat berjemaah sebab tidak mahu bersesak-sesak dgn golongan yang dianggap rendah darinya.
Translated Text:
Even pious people & being educated also has many weaknesses and mistakes.

Hajjaj bin Artah is a fiqh expert and fatwa producer in Kufah & Basra, Iraq.

He left congregational prayers because he did not want to crowd with people who were considered inferior to him.

Text:
Kalaulah beliau hidup zaman sekarang, pasti kena kecam atas kesombongan.

Beliau ulama' besar yang terdedah kepada kekurangan & kelemahan.

Namun, ia tidaklah hancurkan legasi ilmunya yang luas.

Hakikatnya, kitapun banyak sangat kelemahan. Cuma asyik fokus kat orang lain.
Translated Text:
If he lived today, he would have been criticized for his arrogance.

He is a great scholar who is exposed to the lack of & weakness.

However, he did not destroy the legacy of his extensive knowledge.

The fact is, we have a lot of weaknesses. It's just fun to focus on other people.

Text:
Contoh lain, kita bertahun-tahun ambil manfaat ilmu dari asatizah, pakar dalam bisnes, sifu kerjaya yg kita kagumi.

Satu hari, kita nak tahu tentang keluarganya. Rupanya beliau berpoligami (kita tak suka).

Lalu hilang semua respek dan kita tinggalkan mereka+ilmu mereka. Rugi!
Translated Text:
Another example, for many years we have benefited from knowledge from asatizah, experts in business, career masters that we admire.

One day, we want to know about his family. Apparently he is polygamous (we don't like it).

Then all respect is lost and we leave them + their knowledge. Loss!

Text:
Jawapan.

KUNCI MOTOR VESPA.

Kalau perasan ada design motor Vespa. Dalam kunci ni juga ada Immobilizer.

Maksudnya ada cip untuk match dengan Vespa. Walau duplicate kunci sekalipun, takkan boleh start.

Salah satu sebab Vespa jarang hilang.

Terima kasih yang sudi teka 😊👏. https://t.co/hAJ96M8fDL
Translated Text:
Answer.

VESPA MOTOR KEYS.

If you notice there is a Vespa motorcycle design. In this key there is also an immobilizer.

That means there is a chip to match with Vespa. Even if the key is duplicated, it won't start.

One of the reasons Vespa rarely disappears.

Thank you for guessing 😊👏. https://t.co/hAJ96M8fDL

Text:
Part 2.

1998. LRT pertama di Malaysia dibuka oleh STAR LRT setelah beberapa tahun terbengkalai. 

Ada 36 stations untuk route;
Sentul-Ampang
Sentul-Sri Petaling

1999. PUTRA LRT siap utk route Gombak-Kelana Jaya.

Sebahagian station jadi underground railway pertama di Malaysia. https://t.co/dGNxxcXWVT
Translated Text:
Part 2.

1998. The first LRT in Malaysia was opened by STAR LRT after several years of abandonment.

There are 36 stations for the route;
Sentul-Ampang
Sentul-Sri Petaling

1999. PUTRA LRT is ready for the Gombak-Kelana Jaya route.

Part of the station became the first underground railway in Malaysia. https://t.co/dGNxxcXWVT

Text:
Part 3.

2002. Kedua-dua company tu muflis. Kerajaan (melalui Prasarana) bail-out kedua2 company tu dan jenamakan kepada PUTRA Line & STAR Line.

2004. Dijenamakan kepada RAPID KL.

2007. Monorail pula muflis lepas beroperasi 4 tahun. Prasarana ambil alih. Letak bawah RAPID KL. https://t.co/KA65PToSbA
Translated Text:
Part 3.

2002. Both companies went bankrupt. The government (through Prasarana) bailed out the two companies and rebranded them to PUTRA Line & STAR Line.

2004. Branded to RAPID KL.

2007. The monorail went bankrupt after 4 years of operation. Infrastructure takes over. Park below RAPID KL. https://t.co/KA65PToSbA

Text:
Part 4.

2010. DS Najib umum MRT akan dibina route Sungai Buloh-Kajang.

2016. Line Kelana Jaya & Sri Petaling disambung dan bertemu di Putra Heights.

2017. MRT siap dan beroperasi.

Future Line sedang dibina:
Johan Setia Line: Siap 2025 (36km)
Putrajaya Line: Siap 2023 (52km) https://t.co/YfywcIZbNk
Translated Text:
Part 4.

2010. DS Najib announced that the MRT will be built on the Sungai Buloh-Kajang route.

2016. Line Kelana Jaya & Sri Petaling connected and met at Putra Heights.

2017. MRT completed and operational.

Future Line is under construction:
Johan Setia Line: Completion 2025 (36km)
Putrajaya Line: Completion 2023 (52km) https://t.co/YfywcIZbNk

Text:
Part 5.

Tentang kos pembinaan, kos operasi, maintenance, ridership, ROI dan info berkaitan boleh follow Pak @khalidkarim  

Sebagai orang awam, kita harap kerajaan usaha tingkatkan infrastruktur negara dengan kos terbaik dan manfaat untuk lebih ramai orang.

WA. https://t.co/eH5M0YU9Qz
Translated Text:
Part 5.

About construction cost, operation cost, maintenance, ridership, ROI and related info you can follow Mr. @khalidkarim

As members of the public, we hope that the government will work to improve the country's infrastructure at the best cost and benefit more people.

Text: @acaiijawe Peh..sooc ke ustaz?
Translated Text: @acaiijawe Peh..sooc to ustaz?

Text:
Berbanding asatizah muda, mereka biasanya ada pekerjaan tetap dan ramai yang buat bisnes.

Tapi bagi yang telah berusia, mereka tak pandai hatta nak buat kuliah online.

Ada yang dari Mac 2020 dah takde income. Masih ada family untuk disara.

Semoga Allah mudahkan urusan mereka.
Translated Text:
Compared to young asatizah, they usually have permanent jobs and many of them start businesses.

But for those who are old, they are not good at even doing online lectures.

Some have no income from March 2020. There is still a family to support.

May God ease their affairs.

Text: @acaiijawe Sepatutnya mereka sudah berikan ilmu, kita balaslah saat mereka kesusahan 🤲
Translated Text: @acaiijawe They should have given knowledge, we should respond when they are in trouble 🤲

Text:
@fedtriyahya Betul tuan 😊. Kami jemaah masjid ada wujudkan tabung derma untuk asatizah yang dalam kesusahan tersebut.

Ada ustaz tu yang sampai jual kenderaan untuk tampung kehidupan mereka 😪.
Translated Text:
@fedtriyahya That's right sir 😊. We, the congregation of the mosque, have created a donation fund for asatizah who are in trouble.

There are ustaz who even sell vehicles to support their lives 😪.

Text: @acaiijawe Buatla raise funds
Translated Text: @acaiijawe Buatla raise funds

Text:
@lizazahrah Setuju. Ini yang kami sedang usahakan.

Mereka tak meminta-minta, tapi ada yang sampai meminjam duit. Itu yang baru tahu kesusahan beliau.
Translated Text:
@lizazarah Agree. This is what we are working on.

They don't beg, but some even borrow money. That's the only one who knows his predicament.

Translated Text: @acaiijawe As heirs, what can we do to help ustaz

Text:
Ada asnaf fakir miskin yang zakat bagi bantuan sewa rumah. Jumlahnya berbeza-beza ikut keperluan.

Ada had maksimum. Contoh max RM600 sebulan.

Kalau sewa RM700, maka mereka kena usaha tambah lagi RM100 tu sendiri.

Masalah bila tuan rumah naikkan sewa.
Translated Text:
There are poor asnaf who give zakat to help rent a house. The amount varies according to needs.

There is a maximum limit. Example max RM600 per month.

If the rent is RM700, then they have to add another RM100 themselves.

The problem is when the landlord raises the rent.

Text: @acaiijawe Tiada regulations berkaitan kadar inflasi semacam ini ke tuan?
Translated Text: @acaiijawe There are no regulations related to this kind of inflation, sir?

Text: @acaiijawe Tuan rumah pn sengsara musim2 senak perut ni....
Translated Text: @acaiijawe The host is miserable this season with indigestion....

Text:
@mrrfoxtrot Ini betul sebab ada rumah sewa juga. Tapi nak ambil kesempatan camtu pun sebenarnya tak patut juga.

Tahu orang tu sedang susah, kita bagi lagi susah.
Translated Text:
@mrrfoxtrot This is correct because there are houses for rent too. But to take advantage of that is actually not appropriate.

Know that the person is having a hard time, we share more hard times.

Text: @acaiijawe Regulasi berkaitan perumahan ni agak lemah di Malaysia. Rumah PPR dengan kerajaan negeri pun boleh buat sewa siap buat kelas lagi buat sewa guna rumah ni apatah lagi rumah milikan sendiri.
Translated Text: @acaiijawe The regulation related to housing is quite weak in Malaysia. PPR houses with the state government can also be rented ready for classes, let alone self-owned houses.

Text: @faridjani79 Betul tu tuan. Lagi tak bagus, mereka tahu ada pihak lain yang bayarkan dan mereka naikkan sewa.
Translated Text: @faridjani79 That's right sir. It's not good, they know someone else is paying and they raise the rent.

Text: @acaiijawe Kat mana tu? Kalau ada rumah nak diberi sewa macam mana proses dia?
Translated Text: @acaiijawe Where is that? If there is a house to rent, what is the process?

Translated Text: @acaiijawe @akuskizo The covid act can not pay rent and the owner can't take action

Text:
@xandapriv Ini pun betul Nan. Tapi mmg above average sewa tu.

Contoh had maksimum asnaf tu naik ke RM600 dari RM400 (zakat bayarkan).

Kalau sewa RM400, zakat bayar RM400 je.

Dia tahu dah naik kadar tu, dia naikkan ke RM600. Cukup-cukup supaya asnaf tu tak perlu tambah.
Translated Text:
@xandapriv This is correct Nan. But the rent is above average.

For example, the maximum limit for asnaf has increased to RM600 from RM400 (pay zakat).

If the rent is RM400, zakat only pays RM400.

He knew that the rate had gone up, so he raised it to RM600. Enough so that the asnaf does not need to add.

Text:
Satu benda aku belajar, nak 'ubah' pendirian manusia ni memang payah.

Lelagi bab politik dan manhaj agama. Sebab ia melibatkan emosi dan semua bersifat selektif dalam memilih info untuk percaya.

Belajar bertenang.

Dalam thread ni ada pendirian politik yang aku pegang sekarang.
Translated Text:
One thing I learned, trying to 'change' people's attitude is really hard.

Always about politics and religious practices. Because it involves emotions and everyone is selective in choosing information to believe.

Learn to calm down.

In this thread there is a political stance that I hold now.

Text: @acaiijawe @marioskyjuice Selalunya bukan sbb sudut pandang bang. Sudut kewangan nya disitu. DSAI selamanya sukar nak beli jiwa rakyat berpengaruh (T20) sbb DSAI, 'beli' ni bukan caranya. Sbb tu kbanyakan yg menyokong, rakyat marhaen - mostly M40. B40 dh byk termakan budi. Jd boleh faham la kat situ
Translated Text: @acaiijawe @marioskyjuice Usually it's not like your point of view bro. The financial angle is there. DSAI will always find it difficult to buy the souls of influential people (T20) as DSAI says, 'buying' is not the way. That's why most people support it, the people of Marhaen - mostly M40. B40 is too much to consume. You can understand it there

Text:
Kongsi misi bantuan banjir dari sahabat aku. Fokus utama bersihkan rumah pasca banjir.

Inilah rupa rumah selepas banjir. Pak Atan ni dah berusia + sakit jantung. Cuba bersihkan semua tu sendirian.

16 orang dari team Unit Amal Malaysia bantu beliau selama 6 jam baru selesai. https://t.co/j7eRvntHrb
Translated Text:
Share the flood relief mission from my friend. The main focus is to clean the house after the flood.

This is what the house looks like after the flood. Mr. Atan is old + heart disease. Try to clean it all by yourself.

16 people from the Malaysian Charity Unit team helped him for 6 hours to finish. https://t.co/j7eRvntHrb

Text:
Ada banyak lagi rumah perlukan bantuan sebegini sebenarnya. At least rumah bersih untuk tidur.

Tak kisahlah team mereka ini dari parti politik mana, tapi ini yg sepatutnya dilakukan.

Bukan asyik fikir nak merebut kuasa sahaja ketika kita semua dilanda musibah (Covid & banjir). https://t.co/N6sj0UYEbO
Translated Text:
There are many more houses that need this kind of help actually. At least the house is clean to sleep in.

It doesn't matter which political party this team is from, but this is what should be done.

It's not fun to think about grabbing power when we are all hit by calamity (Covid & floods). https://t.co/N6sj0UYEbO

Text:
Nampaknya beratus orang sukarelawan bebas yang terlibat membantu mangsa banjir kena balik sebelum Rabu.

Mereka takut tak boleh keluar-masuk dan kena saman RM1,000.

Mangsa banjir mungkin kena kemas rumah mereka sendiri. Bantuan kena guna official punya jentera.
Translated Text:
It seems that hundreds of independent volunteers are involved in helping flood victims get back home before Wednesday.

They are afraid of not being able to go in and out and being fined RM1,000.

Flood victims may have to clean their own houses. Assistance must be used by officials who have machinery.

Text:
Tahukah anda, kadar Zakat Padi adalah 5% berbanding zakat lain 2.5%.

Zakat Pertanian ini tiada Haul. Maksudnya setiap kali musim tuai, mereka kena terus keluarkan zakat.

Jadi takkanlah kerja ofis gaji RM20k tak kena zakat?

Insyaallah ada masa, aku kongsi tentang zakat padi. https://t.co/7lRzRAHwQu
Translated Text:
Did you know, the rate of Zakat Padi is 5% compared to other zakat 2.5%.

This Agricultural Zakat has no Haul. This means that every harvest season, they have to continue paying zakat.

So won't an office job with a salary of RM20k not be subject to zakat?

God willing, there is time, I will share about rice zakat. https://t.co/7lRzRAHwQu

Text:
@AmadFawwaz Masjid ni sebenarnya mudah nak jaga SOP. Kawasan luas + jemaah terhad + warga emas tidak dibenarkan + solat jarak + takde bersalaman dsb.

Insyaallah risikonya jauh lebih rendah berbanding di kedai makan, pasaraya, pasar malam dan tempat lain dibenarkan beroperasi.
Translated Text:
@AmadFawwaz This mosque is actually easy to maintain SOP. Large area + limited congregation + seniors not allowed + distance prayer + no handshake etc.

God willing, the risk is much lower than in restaurants, supermarkets, night markets and other places allowed to operate.

Text:
Ramai yang berjaya dalam permohonan i-Sinar KWSP DM soalan yang sama sama ada ia dikenakan zakat atau tidak?

Jawapan.

Keluar KWSP sebab dah TIADA pendapatan lain: TIDAK dikenakan zakat.

Selain itu: DIKENAKAN zakat 2.5%.

Sebabnya?

Boleh rujuk thread ini untuk info & ilmu.
Translated Text:
Many who are successful in the i-Sinar EPF DM application have the same question whether it is subject to zakat or not?

Answer.

Exit EPF because there is NO other income: NO zakat is charged.

In addition: CHARGE zakat 2.5%.

The reason?

You can refer to this thread for info & knowledge

Text:
2. Kata Dr. Yusuf al-Qaradawy, mereka ini termasuk dalam Asnaf Gharimin. 

“Mereka yang mendapat pelbagai bencana hidup dan mengalami musibah dalam hartanya, sehingga mempunyai keperluan yang mendesak untuk meminjam bagi dirinya & keluarganya.."

(Hukum Zakat, hal. 595)
Translated Text:
2. Said Dr. Yusuf al-Qaradawy, these people are included in Asnaf Gharimin.

"Those who have various life disasters and experience misfortune in their property, so that they have an urgent need to borrow for themselves & his family.."

(Zakat Law, p. 595)

Text:
3. Kata Imam Mujahid,

"3 kelompok termasuk orang yang mempunyai hutang, iaitu

1. Orang yang hartanya terbawa banjir.
2. Orang yang hartanya musnah terbakar.
3. Orang yang berkeluarga tetapi tiada harta sehingga berhutang untuk menafkahi mereka.

(Hukum Zakat, hal. 595).
Translated Text:
3. Imam Mujahid said,

"3 groups include people who have debts, ie

1. People whose property was washed away by the flood.
2. People whose property was destroyed by fire.
3. People who have a family but have no property so they are in debt to support them.

(Zakat Law, p. 595).

Text:
4. Asnaf Gharimin = Berhutang.

Dalam konteks banjir atau sebarang musibah yang melibatkan bencana alam, ia menyebabkan orang yang mengalaminya menderita kerosakan harta benda yang banyak.

Malah untuk meneruskan kehidupan, ada yang terpaksa berhutang.
Translated Text:
4. Asnaf Gharimin = In debt.

In the context of a flood or any calamity involving a natural disaster, it causes people who experience it to suffer a lot of property damage.

Even to continue living, some have to go into debt.

Text:
5. Maka, syarak melihat ada keperluan untuk zakat berfungsi dengan meringankan beban mangsa melalui bantuan zakat yang dihulurkan.

6. Ada juga beberapa fuqaha meluaskan maksud Fisabilillah hingga boleh bantu yang terkena musibah atau kerosakan kepada negara.
Translated Text:
5. Therefore, syar'a sees the need for zakat to function by easing the burden of the victim through the zakat aid given.

6. There are also some jurists who expand the meaning of Fisabilillah to the extent that it can help those affected by calamity or damage to the country.

Text:
7. Contohnya Imam Ibnu Qudamah:

"Zakat yang dikeluarkan untuk untuk membina jambatan-jambatan dan jalan-jalan, itu adalah zakat yang diperbolehkan dan diterima."

(Hukum Zakat, hal. 620)

8. Namun praktik di negara kita, zakat lebih mendepani keperluan individu berbanding umum.
Translated Text:
7. For example, Imam Ibn Qudamah:

"Zakat issued to build bridges and roads, that is permissible and accepted zakat."

(Zakat Law, p. 620)

8. But the practice in our country, zakat is more in front of individual needs than general.

Text:
9. Maksudnya ada ruang untuk pihak zakat bantu individu (dan keluarga) yang terjejas dengan musibah banjir melalui santunan zakat.

10. Manakala tugas membaiki jalan, jambatan rosak dan sebagainya adalah ditanggung oleh pihak pemerintah.
Translated Text:
9. This means that there is room for the zakat side to help individuals (and families) affected by the flood disaster through zakat compensation.

10. While the task of repairing damaged roads, bridges and so on is borne by the government.

Text:
Kesimpulannya, institusi zakat ni bertindak di bawah pengawasan fatwa & mufti negeri masing-masing.

Ada jawatankuasa syarak yang sentiasa memantau. Mereka pasti tegur jika ada tindakan yang berlawanan dengan syarak.

Kalau kita tak tahu tak semestinya ia tak wujud.

WA.
Translated Text:
In conclusion, this zakat institution acts under the supervision of fatwas & mufti of their respective states.

There is a syaraq committee that constantly monitors. They will definitely reprimand if there is an action that is against the Sharia.

If we don't know it doesn't necessarily exist.

WA.

Text: @acaiijawe Kalau kata zakat untuk Asnaf Al Riqab pun mesti ramai bantah. Huhu
Translated Text: @acaiijawe If you say zakat for Asnaf Al Riqab, there must be many objections. Huh

Text: @adiruzaini05 Betul. Tapi untuk Asnaf Riqab (hamba) dalam konteks harini digunakan untuk pusat-pusat pemulihan akidah dan ajaran sesat, rumah-rumah perlindungan bagi perempuan yang mengandung luar nikah (bawah umur) dan seumpama.
Translated Text: @adiruzaini05 Correct. But for Asnaf Riqab (servant) in today's context it is used for faith recovery centers and heretical teachings, shelters for women who are pregnant out of wedlock (underage) and the like.

Text: @acaiijawe First time saya dengar orang pertikaikan. Tak sangka ada jugak orang macam tu😟😟
Translated Text: @acaiijawe First time I heard people arguing. I didn't think there were people like that 😟😟

Text:
2. Masalah terbesar adalah TANDAS.

Semua tandas TAK BERFUNGSI. Lubang tandas dipenuhi air. Tak boleh flush sebab sekeliling kawasan pusat pemindahan banjir juga digenangi air.

Kasihan orang tua, ibu mengandung atau yang ada anak kecil. Bayangkan situasi itu. Siksa & ngeri. https://t.co/vXhJ6b3aht
Translated Text:
2. The biggest problem is the TOILET.

All toilets DO NOT WORK. The toilet hole is filled with water. Can't flush because the area around the flood evacuation center is also filled with water.

Pity the elderly, pregnant mothers or those with small children. Imagine that situation. Torture & horrible https://t.co/vXhJ6b3aht

Text:
3. Penternak binatang paling kasihan. Ada beratus-ratus ekor lembu, kambing, puluh ribu ekor ayam kena pindah ke tempat lain.

Takde kandang utk letak.
Takde makanan (rumput tenggelam).
Banyak binatang lemas.

Itu belum ayam, kucing dll yang 1-2 minggu duduk atas pokok tak makan. https://t.co/qVG3eWNyrz
Translated Text:
3. The most pitiful animal breeder. There are hundreds of cows, goats, tens of thousands of chickens that have to be moved to other places.

There is no cage to put it.
There is no food (the grass is submerged).
Many animals drowned.

That's not chickens, cats, etc. that sit on trees for 1-2 weeks without eating. https://t.co/qVG3eWNyrz

Text:
4. Banyak pokok mati.

Bila air bertakung, banyak pokok (buah-buahan, bunga, sayur dll) akan lemas.

Kampung aku langsung takde pokok durian. Ia pokok paling manja. 100% confirm mati bila banjir.

Pokok paling tahan, pokok sawit. Sebulan bergenang air, takde satupun yang mati. https://t.co/rXwhw2hvvx
Translated Text:
4. Many dead trees.

When water stagnates, many trees (fruits, flowers, vegetables, etc.) will drown.

My village does not have any durian trees. It is the most spoiled tree. 100% confirmed dead when flooded.

The most resistant tree, the palm tree. A month full of water, no one died. https://t.co/rXwhw2hvvx

Text:
5. Banyak perabot rosak & pintu tak boleh buka.

Kenapa?

Perabot zaman sekarang semua dari serbuk kayu. Bila terendam air, kitchen cabinet, almari baju, meja makan, perabot Ikea dll akan kembang & rosak.

Pintu kayu merantipun kembang. Kena ketam semula.

SEMUA kena beli lain😭. https://t.co/tXqwLaIsyg
Translated Text:
5. Lots of broken furniture & the door cannot be opened.

Why?

Today's furniture is all made of wood shavings. When submerged in water, kitchen cabinets, wardrobes, dining tables, Ikea furniture etc. will expand & damaged

The wooden door is made of flowers. Had to crab again.

ALL have to buy something else😭. https://t.co/tXqwLaIsyg

Text:
6. Selamat tinggal karpet dan tikar getah. Kawasan yang selalu banjir akan pasang tiles satu rumah. Senang nak kemas.

7. Binatang dalam tanah semua keluar. Cacing banyak keluar di lantai tanah (tak timbul). Panjangnya dekat 1 meter. Takut kalau nampak. https://t.co/441em869ld
Translated Text:
6. Goodbye carpets and rubber mats. Areas that are always flooded will install tiles for one house. It's nice to tidy up.

7. Animals in the ground all come out. A lot of worms come out on the ground floor (doesn't pop up). The length is close to 1 meter. Afraid to see. https://t.co/441em869ld

Text:
8. Kena jauhi pokok. Semua jenis binatang liar akan panjat pokok untuk berlindung. Ular sawa, ular tedung, biawak, musang dll.

9. Kejadian kecurian berleluasa. Setiap kali musim banjir, banyak rumah kena pecah masuk. Diaorang ambil kesempatan rumah kosong 😪. https://t.co/7xLpOuoWTg
Translated Text:
8. Stay away from trees. All kinds of wild animals will climb trees for shelter. Pythons, cobras, lizards, foxes etc.

9. Incidents of theft are widespread. Every flood season, many houses are broken into. He took advantage of the empty house 😪. https://t.co/7xLpOuoWTg

Text:
10. Banyak penyakit kulit & cirit birit berlaku kat mangsa selama berminggu-minggu.

Cukuplah setakat ini.

Semoga semua tempat yang dilanda banjir di seluruh negara segera pulih.

Ujian banjir ini seksanya hanya yg pernah alami faham. Emosi, fizikal dan kewangan akan terjejas. https://t.co/iFNrPK4PW4
Translated Text:
10. Many skin diseases & Diarrhea occurs in the victim for weeks.

That's enough for now.

May all flood-affected places across the country recover soon.

This flood test is painful only those who have experienced it will understand. Emotional, physical and financial will be affected. https://t.co/iFNrPK4PW4

Text: @acaiijawe Pernah lalui moments bah besar 2014 kat kelantan. Pertama kali in life rumah naik air terus tenggelam satu rumah. Nak pecah dada tengok keadaan rumah after dah surut. Then, until current pun keadaan dah tak sama mcm sebelum 2014. Perabot pakai apa yg ada je 🥺
Translated Text: @acaiijawe Have been through the big flood moments of 2014 in Kelantan. For the first time in my life, a house went up in water and a house sank. I want to break my heart to see the state of the house after it has receded. Then, until now, the situation is not the same as it was before 2014. Just use whatever furniture is available 🥺

Text: @acaiijawe Menu masa banjir dulu nih adalah telur dadar, sardin(wajib), ikan kering dan ulam n cabai... hari-hari sampai banjir surut.. ada rezeki dapat ikan.. sarapan roti pat segi n air kopi... alhamdulilah dapat mkn
Translated Text: @acaiijawe The menu during the flood was omelette, sardines (obligatory), dried fish and ulam n chili... days until the flood receded.. there was sustenance to get fish.. breakfast bread and coffee water... alhamdulillah can eat

Text: @acaiijawe Yang lain semua betul cuma nombor satu je yg susah, sebab ketua kampung jenis pentingkan diri, kebajikan orang kampung tak jaga. Duduk pps tapi sebab ada ketua kampung kena beli makan kat luar, tahun ni banjir tak duduk pps sebab ada ketua kampung kat situ gak.
Translated Text: @acaiijawe All the others are correct, only number one is difficult, because the village head is self-important, the welfare of the villagers is not taken care of. Sit in PPS but because there is a village head you have to buy food outside, this year the flood did not sit in PPS because there is a village head there, right?

Text: @acaiijawe Betul tuan... walaupun nama banjir merujuk kepada air tetapi time banjir, bekalan air akan terputus dan bekalan elektrik pun akan dihentikan. Makanan alhamdulillah, InsyaAllah tak kan lapar la.
Translated Text: @acaiijawe That's right sir... even though the name flood refers to water but during the flood, the water supply will be cut off and the electricity supply will also be stopped. Food, thank God, God willing, you won't be hungry.

Text: @acaiijawe Saya pernah terlibat banjir di Kemaman tahun 2013/2014. Sempat keluarkan kereta je, betul2 sehelai sepinggang keluar rumah jam 12malam takde tempat tidur. Bila banjir surut speechless tgk keadaan rumah
Translated Text: @acaiijawe I was involved in a flood in Kemaman in 2013/2014. Just had time to get out of the car, it's true that I left the house at 12 midnight without a place to sleep. When the flood recedes speechless about the state of the house

Text: @acaiijawe Pintu tak boleh bukak sebab sofa tilam tong gas semua hadang pintu. Kain baju tilam semuanya kena buang, dah basuh 3,4 kali bau masih ada
Translated Text: @acaiijawe The door can't be opened because the sofa, mattress, gas tank are all blocking the door. The mattress cover must all be thrown away, I have washed it 3,4 times and the smell is still there
